pkgmetadata.longdescription: dwm is a dynamic window manager for X. It manages windows in tiling and floating modes. Tiling means non-overlapping window layout. Floating means windows can be placed on top of each other. Either mode can be applied dynamically, optimizing the environment for the application in use and the task performed.

use.flag: Allows for rearranging windows in a spiral like snail shell. Use ALT-SHIFT-s or ALT-SHIFT-d .
Allows for rotating windows clockwise or counter-clockwise. Use ALT-SHIFT-j or ALT-SHIFT-k.

Allows user to use custom config.def.h to set hotkeys or add header patch hunks. The file must be named ${PN}-${PVR} and stored in /etc/portage/savedconfig/${CATEGORY}/ .
See https://git.suckless.org/dwm/file/config.def.h.html .
